title: Malaria Eradication Board (Repeal) Act, 1975
description: Official consolidated text of Malaria Eradication Board (Repeal) Act, 1975 (LXIV of 1975) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title and commencement
provisions.content:
_ (1) This Act may be called the Malaria
Eradication Board (Repeal) Act, 1975.
(2) It shall come into force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Repeal, etc
provisions.content:
_ (1) The Malaria Eradication Board Ordinance, 1961 (XVIII of 1961),
hereinafter referred to as the Ordinance, is hereby repealed.
(2) Upon the repeal of the Ordinance,â€”
(a)        notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the
conditions of service, the officers and other employees of the Malaria
Eradication Board, hereinafter referred to as the Board, shall stand transferred
to the Federal Government on such terms and conditions as may be laid down
by the Federal Government ;
(b)        all rights, properties, assets, debts, liabilities and obligations of the Board shall
be the rights, properties, assets, debts, liabilities and obligations of the Federal
Government;
(c)        any contract made by the Board before such repeal shall be deemed to have
been made by the Federal Government ; and
(d)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Board before
such repeal shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings instituted by or
against the Federal Government and may be proceeded or otherwise dealt with
accordingly.
(3) The Federal Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to
the transfer and other matters referred to in sub-section (2), make such order as it considers expedient
and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to, as part of the provisions of this Act.
